findings.issue: GDP impact calculation assumes all work hours contribute equally to GDP regardless of productivity differences
Test bounds don't align with calculation range given input distributions

findings.quote: The model suggests a labor supply reduction of **" + String(mean(impact.percentChange), ".1f")
findings.issue: Presenting mean of percentage without noting distribution shape could be misleading for skewed results

errorDetails.raw:
[FINDING]
Category: mathematical_accuracy
Severity: minor
Line: 69
Quote: "incomeEffect = inputs.incomeElasticity * (inputs.ubiAmount / (inputs.avgWage * inputs.baseWorkHours))"
Issue: Formula treats elasticity as applying to percentage of income rather than log income as typical in economics
[/FINDING]

parsed.issue: Formula treats elasticity as applying to percentage of income rather than log income as typical in economics
